Posts.Content: There are (appropriate) rules against posting links here. I use You DO have to exercise some caution when ordering outside the US - the FDA site has some specific non-US mfgrs to avoid. The Canadian government does a decent job of qualifying pharmacies from what I have read. All I can say is that I have used "canadadrugpharmacy" for several years when my medicare prescription drug plan runs out and I have been happy with their product and service.
Posts.Signature: Needle biopsy positive in 6 of 14 samples. Radical Prostatectomy 11-20-08. PSA 4.8 pre-op, 0.01 post-op. Gleason 3+4 both pre and post-op.
Posts.Title: Where to buy affordable Viagra?

Posts.Content: I'm also new to this forum. The generic is called "Silfenafil Citrate" - it is exactly the same active ingredient in Viagra. the generic form is available in almost all nations other than the good ole USA. I use a reputable Canadian mail order pharmacy and the tablets are usually shipped from India. You WILL need a prescription from your physician, and be sure that he/she states "generic substitution allowed". You'll be able to save quite a bit by ordering in quantity so ask your physician to write the prescription for a 3 month supply and specify the daily dosage. Note that some prescription orders coming to you by mail from outside the US will get caught and seized by US Customs, so order well in advance of your needs. The supplier WILL re-ship at no cost to you but they usually make you wait 3 weeks before re-shipping.
Posts.Signature: Needle biopsy positive in 6 of 14 samples. Radical Prostatectomy 11-20-08. PSA 4.8 pre-op, 0.01 post-op. Gleason 3+4 both pre and post-op.
Posts.Title: Where to buy affordable Viagra?

Posts.Content: Jean - many times the drugs are sent from Canada, but with the Canadian mail order pharmacies they also ship from the Carribean, Great Britain, India (in the case of the Cooper brand Silfenadil Sulfate - Cooper is an Indian company), etc - wherever the licensed product originates. The US FDA has specifically named several foreign drug manufacturers to avoid due to failing inspections, etc. ANYONE in the US using a non US mail order facility - even a licensed Canadian pharmacy - should stay current on the US FDA findings.
